item.description:
Should Food Be Thy Medicine?

with Dr. Adiel Tel-Oren, MD

A Practical, Eye-Opening Seminar

6:30 - 8:30 pm  - Lecture

•Hear from Dr. T talk about the latest science-based information that enables us to create the health we desire. Learn proven ways for optimal health & longevity.

Bonus: 8:30 - 8:50 pm "Nepali Adventure"- Personal Experience from an Eco-Trekker

FREE: 8:50-9:15 pm. Brief skin inspections for new patients .

 

Registration: Save 25% online registration, deadline is Wednesday, July 23rd.

Early Bird: $15 at www.DoctorTEvents.com by Wednesday July 25.
$20 at the door. Cash or checks only, please. Thank you!

REMINDER: Saturday, July 28: 9:00am - 5:00pm - Individual Appointments for SkinLesions, Tags, Blemishes Removed.

For more details or to watch a 3-minute video with Dr. T on the skin, visit: www.PathToVibrantHealth.com

Questions: Call Dorothy Torrey, 508-888-6677 or dorothy@PathToVibrantHealth.com

About Dr. Adiel Tel‐Oren (known as “Dr. T”)  is a renowned holistic scientist, author, innovator, and educator – consulting for medical laboratories and medical-nutritional product manufacturers, formulating new products, designing Green Buildings, producing CD’s & DVD’s, appearing on Radio & TV shows, and lecturing to doctors, health practitioners, corporations, government organizations, and the public worldwide on Natural Principles, Functional Medicine, Nutrition, and Sustainability.

He is a licensed European Medical Doctor trained in Europe and in the USA, a US‐licensed, Board‐Certified Nutritionist and professor with the International & American Association of Clinical Nutritionists, board‐certified by the American Board of Functional Medicine, American Board of Chelation Therapy, American Clinical Board of Nutrition, and the American Board of Disability Analysts, and a retired Doctor of Chiropractic.

He is also President Emeritus and Professor of Medical Sciences & Functional medicine at the University of Natural Medicine in Santa Fe.

Dr. T has traveled extensively, offering humanitarian medical care and researching indigenous nutrition practices in Africa, East and South Asia, Europe, the Americas, and the Tropics. He is the Founder of several non‐profit programs worldwide, including The Everest Learning Academy - a network of schools for Orphans and Disadvantaged Nepali Children; a Nepali Community Health Plan caring for 200,000 villagers; The Israeli Center for Functional Medicine; The Eco‐Sphere Green Community Project and Permaculture CSA in Wisconsin; and the Ecopolitan Eco‐Health Network with its numerous communities in the USA ‐ supporting healthy lifestyle, Eco‐Raw Restaurants, Healing Retreats, Clinics, University Degrees and Certification Programs, as well as Tropical Escapes, Foraging trips, and Humanitarian Eco‐Trekking adventures in the Himalayas. Dr. T is also founder of the world's first hypoallergenic GF/DF vegan bakery.
item.name: Should Food Be Thy Medicine? (Plus Free Skin Inspections afterwards)
